description: This course engages students in scientific inquiry while investigating its broader
significance. Students perform experiments from a variety of disciplines to encounter
landmark ideas and to investigate the range of quantitative approaches used to proceed
from raw data to conclusions.  The human ability to recognize patterns and develop models
is examined to understand scientific methods and to assess the power, limits, and current
status of the natural and behavioral sciences. Offered during Interim. Prerequisite: SCICN
fullname: The Well-Ordered Universe: Patterns and Models in Science
